m_szDocSumamry: Energy industry news, analysis, and commentary Cleaning California: Q&A With Dan Adler By Felicity Carus on June 24, 2011 at 3:15 PM Dan Adler is president of the California Clean Energy Fund (CalCEF), a $30 million non-profit venture capital fund created to accelerate investment in the state’s clean energy economy. CalCEF was formed after the California electricity crisis of 1999-2000 as part of the bankruptcy settlement negotiated by the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) and Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E).
